plugins.name: Shape Blur Gradient
plugins.description:
ShapeBlur Gradient helps you create stunning, organic gradients by automatically generating and blending blurred geometric shapes.

With just a few clicks, you can:

  1. Instantly generate unique, soft gradients based on overlapping shapes
  2. Customize colors, number of shapes, blur intensity, and layout
  3. Achieve modern, mesh-style backgrounds and decorative elements
  4. Save time compared to manual shape and blur creation


Perfect for UI designers, illustrators, and anyone looking to add depth and vibrancy to their designs.



Source: https://github.com/midler/ShapeBlurGradient

Features, bugs: figma@midler.xyz

Telegram: @midler
plugins.tagline: Create beautiful blurred gradients from geometric shapes

plugins.name: FrameFlex - Frame Resizer & Scaler
plugins.description:
üîπ FrameFlex ‚Äì Smart Frame Resizing for Figma üéØ

Manually resizing frames can be a nightmare ‚Äî especially when things break.

FrameFlex is a Figma plugin built to help you intelligently scale mobile frames, while preserving structure and layout integrity (when properly set up). ‚ú®


Here‚Äôs what FrameFlex can do:


üîÅ Multi-frame support ‚Äì Resize multiple mobile frames in one action.

üì± Device presets ‚Äì Quickly apply popular mobile screen sizes like iPhone, Android, and more.

üìê Layout-aware resizing ‚Äì Maintains Auto Layout, constraints, and alignment ‚Äî if your design is structured correctly.

üî§ Element scaling ‚Äì Adjusts font size, spacing, strokes, and other properties proportionally.

üéØ Icon/vector protection ‚Äì Prevents scaling on specific elements to avoid distortion.

‚öôÔ∏è Rounding controls ‚Äì Use smart, grid, or exact rounding for clean results.


üí° The more Auto Layout you use, the better the results will be.

FrameFlex works best when your design is clean, consistent, and fully built with Auto Layout in mind.


‚úÖ Focused on mobile-first workflows.

‚ö†Ô∏è Support for other frame types depends on how well they're structured.
plugins.tagline: Resize multiple frames. Preserve structure. Stay consistent.

plugins.name: Promptus
plugins.description:
Promptus is a free Figma plugin that turns text or images into high-quality AI image prompts‚Äîall in just seconds, without leaving Figma.


‚∏ª


Available tools

‚Ä¢Text-to-Prompt ‚Äì type a brief and receive a detailed prompt

‚Ä¢Image-to-Prompt ‚Äì upload an image and extract the underlying prompt

‚Ä¢One-Click Copy ‚Äì copy the ready-to-use prompt wherever you need


‚∏ª


Set up your Google Gemini API key in Promptus:


Open Promptus inside Figma.

Click the gear icon (Settings) in the top-right corner of the plugin panel.

Go to Google AI Studio.

Click ‚ÄúSign in to Google AI Studio‚Äù and authenticate with your Google account.

In the top header, click the ‚ÄúGet API Key‚Äù button.

When prompted, click ‚ÄúCreate API key‚Äù.

In the project pop-up, enter a project name (or select an existing one) and confirm.


Thank you for choosing Promptus! ü§©

üëâ If you have any questions or suggestions, let us know ‚Äî your feedback makes all the difference.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate detailed AI image prompts in Figma

## English


### Overview

AI Alt Text Generator is a Figma plugin that uses Google Gemini or OpenAI Vision APIs to automatically generate accessible alt text for selected images in your Figma file.


### Features

- Generate alt text using **Gemini (Google) or OpenAI Vision API**

- **UI and prompt language switch (Japanese/English)** with a single button

- **API keys are securely saved** using Figma's clientStorage

- **Generate multiple candidates (1‚Äì5) at once, editable and selectable**

- **Keyword input** to influence the generated alt text

- **Image preview** and status display

- **Clear error feedback**


### Setup

1. Install the plugin in Figma

2. Obtain a [Google Gemini API key](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) or an [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

3. Launch the plugin and enter/save your API key(s) in the Settings tab


### How to Use

1. **Select an image node on the Figma canvas**

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "„ÄÅ" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "Êó•Êú¨Ë™û | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.

plugins.name: SaveFrame - Save, Share, and Manage Custom Frames with Ease.
plugins.description:
SaveFrame ‚Äî Figma Frames, Re imagined!


Tired of Figma‚Äôs default frame window? SaveFrame is your modern visual command center for everything frames.

Custom frames, Organize, preview, customize, delete, and share‚Äîlike never before.


Whether you're documenting designs, building moodboards, or curating visual systems, SaveFrame gives you full creative control. It's what Figma frames should feel like.


‚ú® Why designers love SaveFrame:


üîç Instant Frame Previews

  1. No more clicking around. See all your frames at a glance in a clean, scrollable UI.

üß© Drag & Drop Organization

  1. Sort, group, and build collections effortlessly. Your canvas, your logic.

üßπ Smart Deletion

  1. Clear out what you don‚Äôt need‚Äîinstantly. Delete single frames or full sets with confidence.

üìê Save All the Details

  1. Dimensions, effects, layout, constraints‚ÄîSaveFrame remembers the stuff that matters.

üé® Reusable Frame Presets

  1. Create your own frame styles and apply them in one click. Keep your design patterns consistent.

üöÄ Seamless Sharing

  1. Export and import frame collections in seconds.
  2. Perfect for sharing with teammates or individuals‚Äîno friction, no confusion.

‚≠ê Favorite Key Frames

  1. Highlight your best work and access it instantly when it counts.

üåó Light & Dark Mode

  1. A workspace that adapts to your vibe, day or night.



üõ† Built for designers who:

  1. Want more control than Figma gives out of the box
  2. Create and manage multiple frames daily
  3. Build moodboards, docs, and design systems
  4. Hate clutter and love visual clarity
  5. Need a fast way to share organized frames with collaborators


In short:

We took the idea of Figma frames and made it flexible, collaborative, and creator-first.

SaveFrame isn‚Äôt just a tool‚Äîit‚Äôs a better way to work with frames.
plugins.tagline: Figma Frames, Reimagined ‚Äî Save, Share, and Manage Custom Frames with Ease.

plugins.name: Mode Match
plugins.description:
Mode Match lets you take a variable's value from one mode and apply it to other modes. Match a single variable, group of variables, or all variables in a collection!


  1. Select your multi-mode collection
  2. Select the source mode (copy from)
  3. Select the destination mode (copy to)
  4. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  5. Update ‚ú®


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering a path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input


Plugin Notes

  1. Collection list will only show collections with more than 1 mode
  2. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  3. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Supports

  1. All variable types (number, string, boolean, color)
  2. Aliasing
  3. Raw values


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

plugins.tagline: Match variable values across modes.

131968.name: Mode Match
131968.description:
Mode Match lets you take a variable's value from one mode and apply it to other modes. Match a single variable, group of variables, or all variables in a collection!


  1. Select your multi-mode collection
  2. Select the source mode (copy from)
  3. Select the destination mode (copy to)
  4. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  5. Update ‚ú®


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering a path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input


Plugin Notes

  2. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  3. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Supports

  2. Aliasing
  3. Raw values


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

plugins.name: Synchronize Frames
plugins.description:
This program enhances efficiency in Figma by allowing users to synchronize frames automatically. It ensures that any modifications made to a selected frame are instantly reflected in all corresponding frames, promoting consistency across designs. The user interface features intuitive buttons to assign frames, toggle synchronization, and activate auto-sync capabilities.


To automatically search for frames for synchronization, the "SS_" tag must be specified before the frame name.

plugins.name: snapInsert
plugins.description:
snapInsert is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of searching filtering and adding component instances into your designs.

Perfect for designers and teams who work with large design systems, Component Filter helps you save time and maintain focus on your design tasks.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Component Set Filtering: Easily filter components by their set names to focus on specific groups within your design system.

‚Ä¢ Dynamic Key-Value Filtering: Use key-value pairs to narrow down your search and find exactly what you need based on component properties like size, orientation, or any custom attributes.

‚Ä¢ Real-Time Results: As you apply filters, see immediate updates to the component list, ensuring you always have the most relevant components in view.

‚Ä¢ Intuitive UI: The plugin features a clean, user-friendly interface that integrates seamlessly with Figma, making it easy to apply filters and manage your components.


Note:

Currently, Component Filter only searches for components within the file you are working on. In future releases, users will be able to search components from published design libraries, expanding the plugin's functionality to cover broader design systems.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly search and insert component instances from sets or singles into your designs.
